leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 数字健康-临床文本与多模态生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 抽取→标准化→检索→问答→评测

tools.name: Philter (UCSF)
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source clinical text de-identification and PHI redaction tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based clinical text de-identification software that removes Protected Health Information (PHI) from clinical notes. It uses a combination of regular expressions and dictionary-based lookups to identify and redact sensitive information.

tools.name: DiSMed
tools.one_line_profile: De-identification tool specifically for Spanish medical texts
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to de-identify Spanish medical texts, developed by the BIMCV (Medical Imaging Databank of the Valencia Region). It addresses the specific linguistic challenges of Spanish clinical narratives.

tools.name: Tide
tools.one_line_profile: Tiled Interactive Display Environment for large-scale scientific visualization
tools.detailed_description: Software developed by the Blue Brain Project for clustering display screens to create large-scale, high-resolution interactive visualization environments, commonly used for visualizing complex neurological data.

tools.name: FES (Finite Element Solution)
tools.one_line_profile: Global tide model based on hydrodynamic equations and data assimilation
tools.detailed_description: The Finite Element Solution (FES) tide model code, developed by CNES/LEGOS, used for computing global ocean tides. It is essential for oceanography and satellite altimetry data correction.

tools.name: DSA-WSI-DeID
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for redacting PHI from Whole Slide Images (WSI)
tools.detailed_description: A tool integrated with the Digital Slide Archive ecosystem to detect and redact Protected Health Information (PHI) from the label regions of Whole Slide Images (pathology slides).

tools.name: TMD Matlab Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Tide Model Driver (TMD) for accessing polar tide models
tools.detailed_description: A Matlab toolbox provided by Earth & Space Research (ESR) to access specific polar tide models, output harmonic constants, and make tidal predictions. It is a standard tool in polar oceanography.

tools.name: pii-codex
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for detecting, categorizing, and assessing PII severity
tools.detailed_description: A research package designed to detect Personally Identifiable Information (PII) in text and assess its severity. It provides a framework for evaluating PII detection tools and managing data privacy risks.

tools.name: noaa_coops
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for NOAA CO-OPS Tides & Currents Data API
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that facilitates the retrieval of oceanographic data (tides, currents, water levels) from the NOAA CO-OPS API, enabling data acquisition for ocean science research.

tools.name: eo-tides
tools.one_line_profile: Tide modelling tools for satellite Earth observation analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit developed by Geoscience Australia for modeling tides specifically in the context of large-scale satellite Earth observation (EO) data analysis, helping to correct or analyze tidal effects in satellite imagery.

tools.name: Dataflow DLP De-identification
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable data tokenization workflow using Cloud Dataflow and DLP
tools.detailed_description: A reference implementation and tool for creating a scalable de-identification pipeline using Google Cloud Dataflow and Cloud DLP. It is designed for processing large datasets containing sensitive information (PII/PHI) in a compliant manner.

tools.name: Google Healthcare De-id Tools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for de-identifying medical records (DICOM/FHIR) on GCP
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools and scripts provided by Google Cloud Platform to facilitate the de-identification of healthcare data standards like DICOM and FHIR, ensuring compliance with regulations like HIPAA.

tools.name: Kitware DICOM Anonymizer
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to anonymize DICOM files according to DICOM standards
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool developed by Kitware Medical to anonymize DICOM files. It allows for customizable replacement of DICOM tags to ensure patient privacy while maintaining data integrity for research.

tools.name: MIDRC Deidentifier
tools.one_line_profile: Medical imaging de-identification pipeline for MIDRC
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive de-identification pipeline developed by Stanford and Penn for the Medical Imaging and Data Resource Center (MIDRC). It handles the cleaning and redaction of DICOM metadata and pixel data for large-scale public datasets.

tools.name: CVD Prevent Tool
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for linking and curating cardiovascular disease audit data
tools.detailed_description: A data processing pipeline used to link and curate CVD PREVENT audit data with Hospital Episode Statistics (HES) and death registration data, facilitating analysis and publication for public health auditing.

tools.name: OpenSanitizer
tools.one_line_profile: Privacy-focused module for scrubbing PII/PHI from screen data
tools.detailed_description: A module designed to detect and redact Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and Protected Health Information (PHI) from screen data and user actions, supporting privacy compliance in data collection.

tools.name: SyferText
tools.one_line_profile: Privacy-preserving NLP framework
tools.detailed_description: A library for performing Natural Language Processing (NLP) tasks while preserving data privacy, enabling secure text analysis and processing in compliance with privacy standards.

tools.name: deidentify
tools.one_line_profile: HIPAA-compliant PHI de-identification library
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for de-identifying Protected Health Information (PHI) in accordance with the HIPAA Privacy Rule, suitable for clinical data processing in web environments.

tools.name: RSNA DICOM Anonymizer
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM anonymization tool by RSNA
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by the Radiological Society of North America (RSNA) to anonymize DICOM medical imaging files, ensuring patient privacy for research and data sharing.

tools.name: PteRedactyl
tools.one_line_profile: Clinical free-text PII redaction tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python module built on Presidio for redacting Personally Identifiable Information (PII) specifically in clinical free-text, designed for ease of use in healthcare data de-identification workflows.

tools.name: DicomAnonymizer
tools.one_line_profile: Windows application for DICOM anonymization
tools.detailed_description: A Windows application that anonymizes DICOM files and generates PNG and TIF versions, facilitating the safe sharing and visualization of medical imaging data.

tools.name: Canonym
tools.one_line_profile: Data anonymization package by Statistics Canada
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for data anonymization developed by Statistics Canada, providing tools to protect confidentiality in statistical datasets.

tools.name: Medical Image De-identification
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive tool for medical image de-identification
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for the de-identification of medical imaging data, ensuring patient privacy and compliance with data protection regulations for research datasets.

tools.name: MedGuard
tools.one_line_profile: HIPAA compliance library for healthcare LLM agents
tools.detailed_description: A production-grade Python library that ensures HIPAA compliance for large language model (LLM) agents in healthcare, providing security and privacy frameworks for AI workflows.

tools.name: Excel-Anonymizer
tools.one_line_profile: Script for anonymizing Excel datasets
tools.detailed_description: A Python script that anonymizes Excel files by replacing sensitive data with synthesized new data, useful for preparing datasets for sharing or analysis.

tools.name: dicomedit
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript DICOM modification and anonymization library
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for modifying and anonymizing DICOM tags, suitable for use in web-based medical imaging applications and Node.js environments.

tools.name: DICAT
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to anonymize DICOM data headers
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool designed to anonymize DICOM data headers, supporting the de-identification process for medical imaging research.

tools.name: deidentify
tools.one_line_profile: CLI tool for identifying and anonymizing personal information
tools.detailed_description: A simple yet powerful command-line tool written in Go for identifying and anonymizing personal information (PII) in various text formats.

tools.name: bert-deid
tools.one_line_profile: Patient notes de-identification using pre-trained BERT
tools.detailed_description: A library for de-identifying clinical patient notes using pre-trained BERT models, developed by researchers associated with PhysioNet/MIMIC.

tools.name: ARX
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive open source data anonymization tool
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive tool for data anonymization supporting various techniques like k-anonymity, l-diversity, t-closeness, and differential privacy, with risk analysis capabilities.

tools.name: ControlSystemIdentification.jl
tools.one_line_profile: System Identification toolbox for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A system identification toolbox for Julia, compatible with ControlSystems.jl, used for estimating models of dynamic systems from input-output data.

tools.name: Philter (UCSF)
tools.one_line_profile: Clinical free text de-identification software
tools.detailed_description: A clinical free-text de-identification software developed at UCSF to remove Protected Health Information (PHI) from clinical notes.

tools.name: dicognito
tools.one_line_profile: Library and CLI for anonymizing DICOM files
tools.detailed_description: A Python library and command-line tool for anonymizing DICOM files, ensuring patient privacy in medical imaging datasets.

tools.name: Maskwise
tools.one_line_profile: Sensitive data redaction for LLM training datasets
tools.detailed_description: A tool powered by Microsoft Presidio to detect, redact, mask, and anonymize sensitive data across text, images, and structured data, specifically for LLM training datasets.

tools.name: Tide Model Driver
tools.one_line_profile: Tide Model Driver for MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for accessing and using ocean tide models, essential for oceanographic and geophysical research.

tools.name: dicom-anon
tools.one_line_profile: Python DICOM Anonymizer
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for anonymizing DICOM files, developed by the Department of Biomedical and Health Informatics at CHOP.

tools.name: dicom-pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for reviewing and anonymizing DICOM studies
tools.detailed_description: An automated pipeline for reviewing, anonymizing, and publishing research DICOM studies, developed by CHOP.

tools.name: image-deid-etl
tools.one_line_profile: ETL pipeline for DICOM image de-identification and conversion
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by the Center for Data Driven Discovery in Biomedicine (D3b) to assist with reading DICOM images from Orthanc, converting them to anonymized NIfTI images, and uploading them to Flywheel, facilitating secure medical imaging research workflows.

tools.name: Amnesia
tools.one_line_profile: Data anonymization tool for k-anonymity and km-anonymity
tools.detailed_description: Amnesia is a data anonymization tool that transforms relational and transactional data to statistical guarantees (like k-anonymity and km-anonymity) by generalizing or suppressing values, allowing data sharing while preserving privacy.

tools.name: TIDE
tools.one_line_profile: General Toolbox for Identifying Object Detection Errors
tools.detailed_description: A general toolbox for analyzing the sources of error in object detection and instance segmentation algorithms. It provides a detailed breakdown of error types (e.g., classification, localization, background) to help researchers improve computer vision models.

tools.name: deid2-runtime
tools.one_line_profile: Runtime environment for NIST De-ID2 competition
tools.detailed_description: The code execution runtime environment designed for the NIST De-ID2 competition, providing a standardized containerized setup for running and evaluating de-identification algorithms on clinical text data.

tools.name: SlicerBatchAnonymize
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension for batch DICOM anonymization
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer extension designed to perform batch anonymization of DICOM images, enabling researchers to process large datasets of medical imaging for privacy compliance directly within the Slicer environment.

tools.name: pygtide
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for ETERNA PREDICT to compute gravitational tides
tools.detailed_description: A Python module and wrapper for the ETERNA PREDICT program, used to compute gravitational tides on Earth, supporting geophysics and earth science research.

tools.name: PySolid
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for solid Earth tides calculation
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper for computing solid Earth tides, used in geodetic and geophysical applications to model deformations caused by tidal forces.

tools.name: presidio-cli
tools.one_line_profile: CLI tool for PII analysis using Microsoft Presidio
tools.detailed_description: A command-line interface tool developed by Insights Engineering to analyze text for Personally Identifiable Information (PII) entities using the Microsoft Presidio framework, facilitating integration into data processing pipelines.

tools.name: DICOMClient
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM utilities for anonymizing, viewing, and uploading
tools.detailed_description: A set of Java-based utilities for handling DICOM files, including functionality for anonymization, viewing, and uploading to PACS systems, supporting medical imaging data management.

tools.name: deidentification
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to deidentify names and gender-specific pronouns
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool designed to de-identify text by detecting and replacing people's names and gender-specific pronouns, useful for basic text anonymization tasks.

tools.name: CDISC-SDTM-deidentify-SAS-phuse
tools.one_line_profile: SAS macros for de-identifying CDISC SDTM data
tools.detailed_description: A collection of SAS macros to de-identify CDISC SDTM clinical trial data according to PhUSE rules, supporting regulatory compliance and data sharing in clinical research.

tools.name: CTP
tools.one_line_profile: Clinical Trial Processor for medical imaging data management and de-identification
tools.detailed_description: A highly configurable, extensible application designed for processing and routing medical imaging data. It is widely used in clinical trials for secure transfer and comprehensive de-identification of DICOM objects.

tools.name: DicomAnonymizerTool
tools.one_line_profile: Command-line utility for DICOM de-identification
tools.detailed_description: A standalone command-line tool that invokes the MIRC DICOM Anonymizer engine on individual files, facilitating batch processing and automation of medical image anonymization tasks.

tools.name: Tools for Health Data Anonymization
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for anonymizing FHIR health data
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive set of tools designed to facilitate the anonymization of health data, with a specific focus on the FHIR standard. It supports configuration-based anonymization rules to ensure compliance and privacy.

tools.name: Presidio Evaluation Toolkit
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-end toolkit for evaluating PII detection models
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit designed to streamline the evaluation of PII detection frameworks, specifically Presidio. It integrates with Azure Language Service and AzureML to provide end-to-end assessment pipelines for different PII recognizers.

tools.name: Presidio
tools.one_line_profile: Context-aware PII detection and anonymization framework
tools.detailed_description: An open-source framework for detecting, redacting, masking, and anonymizing sensitive data (PII) in text and images. It utilizes NLP and pattern matching to provide customizable and context-aware PII recognition.

tools.name: Presidio Research
tools.one_line_profile: Research library for developing Presidio PII recognizers
tools.detailed_description: A package dedicated to data science tasks for developing and evaluating new PII recognizers for the Presidio framework. It facilitates the creation of datasets, training of models, and benchmarking of detection performance.

tools.name: DICOMAnonymizer
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-threaded anonymizer for DICOM files implementing DICOM PS 3.15 AnnexE
tools.detailed_description: A C++ based tool designed for the anonymization of DICOM medical imaging files. It implements the standards set forth in DICOM PS 3.15 Annex E, ensuring compliance with de-identification protocols suitable for clinical and research data sharing.

tools.name: ttide_py
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of the T_Tide harmonic tidal analysis package
tools.detailed_description: A direct conversion of the classic T_Tide MATLAB toolbox to Python. It performs classical harmonic analysis of tidal currents and sea levels, widely used in oceanography and geophysics for analyzing tidal data.

tools.name: deidentify
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for de-identifying medical records using NLP methods
tools.detailed_description: A library designed to automatically de-identify free-text medical records. It utilizes state-of-the-art Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques to detect and redact Protected Health Information (PHI), facilitating privacy-preserving data usage in healthcare research.

tools.name: ehr_deidentification
tools.one_line_profile: De-identification of medical notes using transformer architectures
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool leveraging transformer models (like BERT/RoBERTa) to perform robust de-identification of electronic health record (EHR) notes. It focuses on identifying and masking sensitive entities to ensure patient privacy in clinical text data.

tools.name: svs-deidentifier
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to strip identifying labels from Aperio SVS whole slide images
tools.detailed_description: A Python utility specifically designed for digital pathology. It removes potentially identifying label and macro images from Aperio SVS whole slide image files, ensuring that pathological slides can be shared or analyzed without compromising patient anonymity.

tools.name: EDF_deidentify_toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Matlab and Python toolbox for de-identifying EDF (EEG) files
tools.detailed_description: A toolbox developed by the Prerau Lab for de-identifying European Data Format (EDF) files, commonly used for EEG and sleep data. It allows researchers to strip headers and metadata to share physiological data compliantly.

tools.name: Mist
tools.one_line_profile: Adversarial watermarking tool to protect images from diffusion model mimicry
tools.detailed_description: A preprocessing tool that applies adversarial watermarks to images (artworks) to disrupt the learning process of latent diffusion models (like Stable Diffusion). It is used in AI security and data protection research to prevent unauthorized style mimicry.

tools.name: Mist-v2
tools.one_line_profile: Improved watermarking tool for protecting artwork from synthetic mimicry
tools.detailed_description: The second version of the Mist tool, providing enhanced adversarial watermarking capabilities to protect human artworks from being effectively used to train synthetic media generation models.

tools.name: pydicom-deid
tools.one_line_profile: Best-effort anonymization library for medical images (DICOM) in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library built on top of pydicom for de-identifying DICOM files. It provides a framework for defining anonymization recipes and cleaning metadata to support medical imaging research and compliance.

tools.name: dicom-cleaner
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for detecting and cleaning burned-in pixels in DICOM images using OCR
tools.detailed_description: A development tool associated with pydicom for detecting and removing burned-in text (pixel data) from DICOM images using Optical Character Recognition (OCR), addressing a critical gap in metadata-only anonymization.

tools.name: Pytides
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for tidal analysis and prediction
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for analyzing and predicting tides. It allows for the decomposition of tide levels into constituent components and the prediction of future tide heights, used in oceanographic research.

tools.name: Cumulus ETL
tools.one_line_profile: ETL pipeline for extracting, de-identifying, and loading FHIR clinical data
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to extract FHIR data from healthcare systems, transform it using NLP and de-identification tools, and load it into a SQL database for research and analysis. Developed by the SMART on FHIR team.

tools.name: Stanford MIRC-CTP Scripts
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM anonymization scripts based on MIRC CTP
tools.detailed_description: A set of scripts and Docker configurations used by Stanford IRT/RIT for anonymizing medical imaging data (DICOM) using the MIRC Clinical Trial Processor (CTP).

tools.name: Tideline
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization library for diabetes data timelines
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library developed by Tidepool for visualizing diabetes device data (e.g., blood glucose, bolus, basal rates) in a timeline format, supporting clinical data analysis.

tools.name: deidentifyr
tools.one_line_profile: R package for de-identifying datasets with PII
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to identify and remove personally identifiable information (PII) from datasets, supporting data privacy compliance in research.
